articles.description: Latest news on the search for a vaccine against the new coronavirus
articles.content:
As Covid-19 has rapidly spread around the world there has been a mad scramble to find a vaccine. 
In the UK a potential coronavirus vaccine being developed at the University of Oxford will begin human trials from Thursday, Matt Hancock, the Health Secretary,… [+1550 chars]

articles.description: CORONAVIRUS has caused mass havoc in its wake. The UK's updated cases of death from the deadly virus sits at an astonishing 17,337. Having toes which resemble the following could mean you're at risk of an infection.

articles.description: From teams of 'corona detectives' to Army cadets making thousands of calls a day, countries are tracking the spread of Covid-19
articles.content:
Countries around the world are rushing to launch contact tracing apps to identify who an infected person has had contact with, as part of efforts to slow the spread of the coronavirus. 
The UK Government has announced the infrastructure was being put in plac… [+1754 chars]

articles.title: 'One in a million' nurse described 'excruciating' symptoms before dying of coronavirus - Mirror Online
articles.description: Angela Cunningham's death saw an outpouring of grief on social media, where the veteran nurse had detailed her agonising symptoms, including vomiting and muscle pain, in the days before going into hospital
articles.content:
The heartbreak of a popular nurse's tragic death from coronavirus, just days before she turned 60, will "never heal", her brother has said.
Angela Cunningham, known as Angie, had been on a ventilator in ITU at Borders General Hospital for a week after testin… [+2692 chars]
